trans-unit.source: Use a script
trans-unit.target: Usar um script

trans-unit.source: Beginner Programmer
trans-unit.target: Introdução Programação

trans-unit.source: To use a script, add it to an entity as a component. You can do this in Game Studio or in code. Stride runs scripts when the entity they are attached to loads.
trans-unit.target: To use a script, add it to an entity as a component. You can do this in Game Studio or in code. Stride runs scripts when the entity they are attached to loads.

trans-unit.source: You can add a single script to as many entities as you need. You can also add multiple scripts to single entities; in this case, Stride creates multiple instances of the script. This means the same script can have different values in its public properties and fields.
trans-unit.target: You can add a single script to as many entities as you need. You can also add multiple scripts to single entities; in this case, Stride creates multiple instances of the script. This means the same script can have different values in its public properties and fields.

trans-unit.source: Add a script in Game Studio
trans-unit.target: Add a script in Game Studio

trans-unit.source: There are three ways to add scripts to entities in Game Studio:
trans-unit.target: There are three ways to add scripts to entities in Game Studio:

trans-unit.source: drag the script from the asset view to the entity tree
trans-unit.target: drag the script from the asset view to the entity tree

trans-unit.source: drag the script from the asset view to the entity properties
trans-unit.target: drag the script from the asset view to the entity properties

trans-unit.source: add the script in the property grid
trans-unit.target: add the script in the property grid

trans-unit.source: Drag to the entity tree
trans-unit.target: Drag to the entity tree

trans-unit.source: This method automatically creates a new entity that contains the script.
trans-unit.target: This method automatically creates a new entity that contains the script.

trans-unit.source: In the solution explorer (in the bottom left by default), select the assembly that contains your script. Game Studio shows your script in the asset view.
trans-unit.target: In the solution explorer (in the bottom left by default), select the assembly that contains your script. Game Studio shows your script in the asset view.

trans-unit.source: Script in asset folder
trans-unit.target: Script in asset folder

trans-unit.source: Drag the script from the asset view to the entity tree.
trans-unit.target: Drag the script from the asset view to the entity tree.

trans-unit.source: Game Studio adds an entity to your scene, with the script as a component on the entity.
trans-unit.target: Game Studio adds an entity to your scene, with the script as a component on the entity.

trans-unit.source: Entity tree
trans-unit.target: Entity tree

trans-unit.source: Drag to the property grid
trans-unit.target: Drag to the property grid

trans-unit.source: In the entity tree (on the left by default), or in the scene, select the entity you want to add the script to.
trans-unit.target: In the entity tree (on the left by default), or in the scene, select the entity you want to add the script to.

trans-unit.source: In the solution explorer (in the bottom left by default), select the assembly that contains your script. Game Studio shows your script in the asset view.
trans-unit.target: In the solution explorer (in the bottom left by default), select the assembly that contains your script. Game Studio shows your script in the asset view.

trans-unit.source: Script in asset folder
trans-unit.target: Script in asset folder

trans-unit.source: Drag the script from the asset view to the property grid.
trans-unit.target: Drag the script from the asset view to the property grid.

trans-unit.source: Game Studio adds the script to the entity.
trans-unit.target: Game Studio adds the script to the entity.

trans-unit.source: Add the script in the property grid
trans-unit.target: Add the script in the property grid

trans-unit.source: In the scene editor, select the entity you want to add the script to.
trans-unit.target: No <g id="1">Scene view</g>, selecione a entidade que deseja adicionar o script para:</g>

trans-unit.source: Select an entity
trans-unit.target: Selecionar uma entidade

trans-unit.source: In the property grid (on the right by default), click Add component and select the script you want to add.
trans-unit.target: In the property grid (on the right by default), click Add component and select the script you want to add.

trans-unit.source: Add script component
trans-unit.target: Add script component

trans-unit.source: Game Studio adds the script to the entity.
trans-unit.target: Game Studio adds the script to the entity.

trans-unit.source: !Note You can customize where scripts appear in the dropdown using the ComponentCategoryAttribute:
trans-unit.target: !Note You can customize where scripts appear in the dropdown using the ComponentCategoryAttribute:

trans-unit.source: Add a script from code
trans-unit.target: Add a script from code

trans-unit.source: The code below adds a script to an entity.
trans-unit.target: The code below adds a script to an entity.

trans-unit.source: // myEntity is an existing entity in the scene; myAsyncScript is the script you want to add to the entity myEntity.Add(new myAsyncScript());
trans-unit.target: // myEntity is an existing entity in the scene; myAsyncScript is the script you want to add to the entity myEntity.Add(new myAsyncScript());

trans-unit.source: See also
trans-unit.target: Veja também
